section.title: Introduction
section.para: The &name-rep; is based on the &name-idoutils; backend and just like the &name-core;, it will support all major database platforms.
Here we'll give you some instructions on how to install the &name-rep; with &name-jasper;.

section.title: Official Docs
section.para: For more information, please refer to http://sourceforge.net/projects/jasperserver/files/JasperServer/JasperServer%204.7.0/JasperReports-Server-CP-Install-Guide.pdf or http://jasperforge.org/espdocs/espbrowse.php?id=86&type=folder&group_id=112&parent=86

listitem.para: &name-icinga; and &name-idoutils;
Installed via sources or packages.

note.para: Starting with &name-icinga; 1.8 there is a database function providing all needed sla-informations. This function needs to be installed additional to the &name-rep; package.

listitem.para: &name-mysql;
Apache Tomcat
Only if you don't want to use the bundled one from JasperServer
&name-postgres;
Only if you don't want to use the bundled one from JasperServer. &name-postgres; is required for JasperServer's internal storage.

note.para: JasperServer changed their backend from &name-mysql; to &name-postgres; in 4.2.1! Source

listitem.para: &name-jasper;

note.para: The new &name-jasper; 4.7.0 is only supported starting with &name-rep; 1.8. If you want to use an older version of the &name-rep;- package, please use &name-jasper; 4.5.0 or older.

listitem.para:
Depending on your architecture (uname -a), fetch the appropriate installer - below is x64 $> wget http://sourceforge.net/projects/jasperserver/files/JasperServer/JasperServer%204.7.0/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0-linux-x64-installer.run
$> chmod +x jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0-linux-x64-installer.run $> sudo ./jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0-linux-x64-installer.run
Agree to license
select bundled tomcat
select bundled postgresql
select a different postgresql port, like 5433, not to interfere with existing setups
install sample reports and ireports
The installer will automatically create the needed database, create the schema and install samples.

note.para: The default installation location will be /opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0/, so make sure to work on the correct &name-jasper; if you are doing an upgarde!

listitem.para: #> cd /opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0/ #> ./ctlscript.sh startFor individual components #> ./ctlscript.sh postgresql start|stop #> ./ctlscript.sh tomcat start|stop

section.title: Icinga Reporting
section.para: As from Icinga 1.6 on, the package provides configure and make scripts.

listitem.para: Sources

Download from sourceforge and extract. If you have an issue which might be solved in the developer version then get the latest developer snapshot from git $> wget http://sourceforge.net/projects/icinga/files/icinga-reporting/1.8.0/icinga-reports-1.8.0.tar.gz; \ tar xzf icinga-reports-1.8.0.tar.gz; \ cd icinga-reports-1.8.0or $> git clone git://git.icinga.org/icinga-reports.git ; \ cd icinga-reports
If a developer told you to use his/her branch, check that out with
listitem.screen: $> git branch localbranch origin/devhead/devbranch $> git checkout localbranch $> git log

listitem.para: Configure
If you did not install the &name-jasper; into the default prefix before, you need to tell configure the location. $> ./configure --with-jasper-server=/opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0
Make
Invoke 'make' without params to get a full list of available options.
&name-mysql; Connector

&name-jasper; natively ships with the &name-postgres; Connector, but if you require &name-mysql;, the &name-rep; package provides one for install. #> make install-mysql-connectorRestart the Tomcat server #> cd /opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0 #> ./ctlscript.sh stop tomcat #> ./ctlscript.sh start tomcat
Install
&name-jasper; must be running! #> make installRestart the Tomcat server #> cd /opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0 #> ./ctlscript.sh stop tomcat #> ./ctlscript.sh start tomcat

section.title: Configuration
section.para: Open the webinterface, default credentials are jasperadmin:jasperadmin

listitem.para: IDO
Go to /root/Icinga/datasource (be sure that Refine contains "changed by anyone").
edit the existing datasource and configure your values.
test the configuration and save the connection.
all reports in our package point to this datasource and should be able to run.

section.title: Reports
section.para: Verify that the reports are available and working.

listitem.para: Display Errors

org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Handler processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.InternalError: Can't connect to X11 window server using ':0' as the value of the DISPLAY variable.The tomcat being run as root, trying to access the users x11 display. Allow it for everyone locally. $> xhost +local:all
Generation Errors

org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Handler processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class net.sf.jasperreports.engine.util.JRStyledTextParserIt could be Sun AWT trying to connect to X11 classes, but actually it's the PDF generation on a report. $> sudo apt-get install msttcorefonts $> cd /opt/jasperreports-server-cp-4.7.0 $> sudo sh ctlscript.sh stop $> sudo sh ctlscript.sh start
